title: How TotalEnergies and France's foreign ministry work hand in hand
summary: Every year, the French oil company recruits veteran diplomats for its lobbying department. It's a practice that sheds light on the French foreign ministry's contradictions, particularly on the issue of climate change.

title: Biden orders temporary Mexico border closure for asylum seekers
summary: The Democratic president is signing a decree that would prevent irregular migrants from accessing the asylum system if the number of such arrivals exceeds 2,500 per day, in a move reminiscent of Trump's border policies.

title: Modi claims victory in India, opposition says voters 'punished' PM's party
summary: Narendra Modi is set to remain India's prime minister but his party, the BJP, failed to secure an overall majority of its own, official results showed late on Tuesday, June 4.

title: 'He'll have to adapt, like the others': Real Madrid fans eagerly await Kylian Mbappé's arrival
summary: Following the announcement of the French football team captain's arrival at the Spanish capital's flagship club, Galacticos fans are happy but waiting to see.

title: D-Day landings: The battle against erosion
summary: The key D-Day sites are suffering the effects of climate change. Faced with the threat of losing the original traces of the battlefields of June 6, 1944, work is already underway to preserve them, but the future remains uncertain.

title: Is ChatGPT a better parent than we are?
summary: Generative artificial intelligence can tell our children stories on demand and answer their incessant questions. It is a model for positive parenting?

title: French Open 2024: Novak Djokovic withdraws due to knee injury
summary: The 24-time Grand Slam champion had been due to play Casper Ruud in the quarter-finals on Wednesday.

title: Slovenia becomes the latest European country to recognize Palestina
summary: The decision came days after Spain, Norway and Ireland did the same, a move that was condemned by Israel. More than 140 countries recognize a Palestinian state.

title: French Open 2024: Gauff bounces back to beat Jabeur and reach the semi-finals
summary: The world number three was one set down to Ons Jabeur before she roared back, winning 4-6, 6-2, 6-3 on Tuesday to qualify for the semi-finals.

title: French parliament once again in uproar over Palestinian flag
summary: Amid left-wing lawmakers dressed in the colors of the Palestinian flag, radical left La France Insoumise party MP Rachel Keke stood up and brandished the flag. The president of the Assemblée Nationale sanctioned her and temporarily suspended the session.

title: Why are some Taylor Swift fans reporting post-concert amnesia?
summary: Known as 'transient global amnesia,' this not-so-rare phenomenon has been described in connection with emotionally-charged events.

title: Romania opens borders to South  Asian workers to replace emigrants
summary: Long closed to all forms of immigration, the country, like most others in Central and Eastern Europe, has been opening up to foreigners in recent years under pressure from employers complaining of labor shortages.

title: Mexico's left wins large majority in congress after Claudia Sheinbaum's victory
summary: The June 2 general elections confirmed the virtual disappearance of the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI), which had been in power for almost 80 years.

title: Zelensky to meet with Macron in Paris on Friday
summary: The Ukrainian president, who has recently been on a tour of allied countries, is also due to address France's Assemblée Nationale after the country's D-Day commemorations on Thursday, June 6.

title: Hunter Biden's trial keeps US presidential campaign in the courtroom
summary: Joe Biden's son's trial for illegal possession of a firearm began on Monday in Delaware. For Republicans and the conservative media, it's an opportunity to hit back after Trump's conviction.

title: Putin opponents exiled in Georgia are worried: 'It started like this in Russia'
summary: The 'foreign influence' bill, which was modeled on a Russian law, was signed into Parliament on Monday, and seen as 'a step toward dictatorship.'

title: New Caledonia: Insecurity persists as radicals continue to orchestrate the crisis
summary: Despite guarantees from the authorities, finding food, transport and medical care remains a major challenge in Nouméa's northern districts after three weeks of insurrection. Elected representatives call on Emmanuel Macron to drop his electoral reform.

title: Macron tells Netanyahu Palestinian Authority should govern Gaza
summary: The French president backed the proposal for a Gaza ceasefire in phone talks with Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday.

title: Arizona voters will decide if local police can arrest people for illegally crossing border
summary: Voters will decide whether to make it a state crime for noncitizens to enter the state through Mexico at any location other than a port of entry, sending the measure to the Nov. 5 ballot.

title: War in Gaza: The EU's diplomatic failure
summary: Divided between a pro-Israel camp and another committed to respect for international law, the 27 EU members have been weak in their response to Israel's bombardment of Gaza since the October 7 attacks.
